meanings.definition: A person who imposes something, such as a tax or a burden.
meanings.sent1: The imposers demanded a higher tax rate from the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The imposers placed a heavy burden on the workers with new regulations.
meanings.sent3: The imposers tried to make everyone pay extra taxes for breathing air.
meanings.sent4: The imposers were like greedy tax collectors, taking more than their fair share.
meanings.sent5: The imposers were like weightlifters, piling on more and more burdens on the people.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The imposers promised great riches but only brought disappointment.
meanings.sent2: Beware of the imposers who try to sell you fake products.
meanings.sent3: The imposers pretended to be lost tourists to steal from unsuspecting locals.
meanings.sent4: The imposers were like skilled magicians, tricking people with their illusions.
meanings.sent5: The imposers were like sly foxes, always finding new ways to deceive others.

meanings.definition: A person who forces something on others.
meanings.sent1: The imposers insisted on their own rules without considering others' opinions.
meanings.sent2: The imposers pushed their beliefs onto everyone around them.
meanings.sent3: The imposers tried to make everyone follow their strict diet plan.
meanings.sent4: The imposers were like dictators, imposing their will on the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The imposers were like unstoppable forces, compelling others to obey their commands.
